alert.note: Alert for Eastern Grant; Eastern Mineral; Eastern Pendleton; Hampshire; Hardy; Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 4:35AM EST until January 17 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible, which may mix with sleet or freezing rain at times. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches are most likely, with up to 15 inches possible. Ice accumulations of a light glaze are possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph, and may create blizzard conditions at times especially over higher terrain. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, the Shenandoah Valley and central and northern Virginia Blue Ridge, and the eastern West Virginia panhandle. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may fall at 1 to 3 inches per hour late Sunday afternoon into Sunday night, resulting in nearly impassable roads. Visibility may be reduced to a quarter mile or less at times.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
